result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cain Botello

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cain Botello in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Cain Botello.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for a status conference. Defense requested a motion hearing date. State did not object. Case adjourned to Branch 19.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report
Original transcript of  Preliminary Hearing Commencing 5-24-2022( 17 pages) received and filed by Court reporter: Kathleen Worden.

Defendant Cain Botello in court.  Attorney Christopher J. Cherella in court for Cain Botello.  Attorney Alex Carlson for Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin.   Case called on the record by the court.  Statements heard as to substitution of court official made on 5/24/2022.  Court ordered case transferred to Judge Kori Ashley.  Court removed the 11/11/2022 motion hearing from Branch 37. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Received and Filed by Christopher Cherella.
Motion to Suppress Evidence.

Attorney Christopher J. Cherella appeared with defendant Cain Botello. Thomas Hasle appeared for the State. 
Due to rotation effective August 1, 2022, this felony matter was mischeduled in Branch 13. 
Clerk placed matter back onto Branch 37's calendar for a motion hearing on 11/11/2022 at 10:00 a.m. Parties notified
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report, received and filed.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Laura A. Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.

Defendant Cain Botello in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judical notice of 3 prior OWI convictions. Sworn for the State: West Milwaukee Officer Z. Seefeld. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cain Botello in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case is set for a preliminary hearing. State's witness is present. Defense was recently retained and need more time to speak with client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 036855,
Payable Number: 1000268,
Receipt Number: 22RP015537,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.   The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Cain Botello in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Cain Botello in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
